title: Earthquake rocks philippine area
author: Reuters
text: MANILA - An earthquake in the southern Philippines forced hundreds of people to flee their homes, but there were no reports of casualties and damage was minimal, seismologists said today.        The quake, which measured 6.2 on the open-ended Richter scale, occurred near the town of Bislig on Mindanao island, 570 miles south of Manila, the seismologists said.        A tremor measuring 7.3 on the Richter scale struck Bislig last December, killing three people. A 7.7 magnitude earthquake last July killed more than 1,600 people on the northern island of Luzon.
